intro: Ludwigia pubescens var. linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments. The plant is characterized by its elongated, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated in ponds and water gardens for its ornamental value. Ludwigia pubescens var. linearis prefers moderate to high light conditions and can tolerate a range of water temperatures.
